website_summaries.verdict: This book covers a wide array of flowers and has good maps to help with identification.
pros: A good reference manual with lots of photos
cons: The pictures in this book are a little small
The book is a little thick to be used as a field guide

customer_reviews.title: Best wildflower book ever!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't hurt that there just aren't that many wildflower books with recent publication dates. It is rather large, too large to carry in the field unless you carry a backpack (which I do). But it is absolutely the best for study and reference. I particularly like the close up pictures of the flowers in the front by color. You cannot go wrong with this guide. The price is great for such a wonderful book.
customer_reviews.author: Value Conscious

customer_reviews.title: Wide variety of wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: I really like this field guide to wildflowers. It includes a wide variety of species and types, even introduced species from other countries. The book is well organized and has a lot of photos. It is easy to navigate through and look up any flowers you are looking for. Each flower name is alphabetically organized in the index. I recommend this for anyone who is interested in learning about the wildflowers of North America.
customer_reviews.author: Dash10

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised. Truly disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: The book is titled a Field Guide to Wildflowers of North America, which is why I bought it, Canada being the greater land mass of North America. Plus it had lots of photos. But the book is most certainly not a catalogue of the wildflowers of North America. It illustrates only the wildflowers of the Continental United States. How could such a glaring missrepresentation of its contents pass editorial scrutiny? Pretty much a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: forbes

customer_reviews.title: Great book for the range that it covers.
customer_reviews.text: This book is outstanding. It covers a huge range but has enough information and diversity of species to make it useful everywhere. It won't always have the species that you're looking for but it has enough to at least get you more than just in the ballpark. It's not a technical book and a basic understanding of plant familes will help the user navigate through the vast number of species presented. I hope the NWF reprints this book because there are no equal options out there. The price of this book can get insane when there are few available used copies on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Edward I Boyd

customer_reviews.title: A Good Comprehensive Guide
customer_reviews.text: The book is a good all-around one, but a bit overwhelming. I bought the book mainly because the front part divides the flowers by colors which I thought would be very helpful. But often it will show just one of the colors and doesn't includes others. So if you see a pink flower and they show it in blue it might be a little more difficult to identify. The maps of where the flowers are found are very helpful. The flower descriptions well done. The book itself is thick thus making it a little difficult to carry around as a field guide. It's best left home as a reference tool.
customer_reviews.author: djd

customer_reviews.title: Best book i have seen
customer_reviews.text: Best book i have seen. Multiple photographic info on one plant, excellent written info, and US maps for loaction. It is really an excellent reference!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Book for Lovers of Wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: A compact but heavy little book-zillions of photos of wildflowers and excellent descriptions. This is one of the books my homeschooled son checked out of the library that we ended up going on Amazon and purchasing. Well-worth the price, and a permanent personal library reference.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vest

customer_reviews.title: One great field guide.
customer_reviews.text: Also own the insect field guide as well and both are amazing for any environmentalist. Beautiful images and great descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wildflower guide.
customer_reviews.text: The best wildflower guide I’ve found. Accurate information with very good, clear images and good range maps. Much better than the Audubon guide.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Splendid Wildflower Guide
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent field guide with pictures that are clear and make recognizing a wildflower in the field much easier than with other guides. I was able to ID a plant which has been a puzzle for 3 years. It is a really great addition to any nature library.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret R. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Go Wild for Flowers
customer_reviews.text: As someone once said, "May all your weeds be wildflowers." This volume will help you bring purpose to your nature walks.
customer_reviews.author: Hapzydeco

customer_reviews.title: A well used reference.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are constantly referring to this book through out the spring and summer to help put names to wildflowers we encounter.
customer_reviews.author: Blackpowder

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  A Learning experience
customer_reviews.text: My wife treasures this book. I bought it for her because I love her. Well written and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hughes

customer_reviews.title: No Dandelion Look Alikes
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a wonderful book, it lacks the one thing for which I bought it: dandelion look-a-likes. I am interested in discovering the identities and uses of numerous dandelion-like plants in my garden, but this book states in the dandelion section that it doesn't cover that topic. This disappointed me, but otherwise, it's a fine handbook, and I will use it often.
customer_reviews.author: j harry duggan

customer_reviews.title: Good Guide
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures, but somewhat difficult to ID unfamiliar flowers amongst the myriad of choices.
customer_reviews.author: o3man

customer_reviews.title: very good field book
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but a little heavy to carry, but will fit into large pocket. Seems to be very well made and will stand up to field use.
customer_reviews.author: Belle Rogers

customer_reviews.title: My response
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson is collecting this set of books. He loves them! Looking for a book on mammels, Haven't found one yet, Thanks Karen
customer_reviews.author: Karen Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Tha book is high quality product, Contains lots of photos, and the price was right. It's not much help when trying to identify a flower your holding in your hand. The thumbnail photos are too small and many do not show details of the flower. My lawn is covered with a with a wild flower (weed) which, is seems to me, to make it a very common thing. I've gone through this book, page by page and can't find it. I wouldn't recommend it if you need detailed help identifying a flower.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: Wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: I received this item only 3 days after ordering and it was in excellent condition. I would use this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Lucha

customer_reviews.title: book review
customer_reviews.text: I had perused this text before. Excellent resource for wildflower identification. Amazon had it for a great price! Very satisfied with timely arrival.
customer_reviews.author: F. Ambio

customer_reviews.title: I love these books
customer_reviews.text: I just gave a brief run through, hope it helps! I love all of these books!!
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Wildflowers of North America
customer_reviews.text: The books arrived in excellent condition. I would definitely order from that supplier again.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: ALL KINDS OF AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This book has a nice cover that is waterproof. Inside that beautiful cover are pages and pages of wildflowers. Packed with information and beautiful photos, this wildflowers field guide is an absolute must have!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSmile

customer_reviews.title: wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wildflower guide as a gift for a long time friend, but before I sent it off I did look through it. What a fantastic book!! I can't believe that there isn't a wildflower that is not in this book. The pictures are great and soooo many of them. If you are interested in flowers, especially the wildflowers this is a must have book.
customer_reviews.author: Holly H. Short

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful book for the botanically minded individual that is familiar ...
customer_reviews.text: While this book is certainly not a comprehensive flora, it is a cursory glance at herbaceous flowering plants of North America. This is a wonderful book for the botanically minded individual that is familiar with familial relationships. I am in California, and this book doesn't come close to covering the diversity of plants here. I simply appreciate the book for what it is; a tome covering a majority of plant families in North America with select genera represented with a beautiful array of color images.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent guide
customer_reviews.text: I have many wildflowers guides in my personnal library. This particular edition has become one of my favorites. It's quite easy to find what you're looking for and the photographs are very nice. I'd recommend this book for anyone who loves wildflowers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sharit Atchison

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The color charts at the beginning are a great tool to narrowing the choices and making identity easier.
customer_reviews.author: GARY

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: We gave this as a gift to our sister that is an Earth Science teacher at a Ma. middle school and she said ti was one of the best books she had seen.
customer_reviews.author: Huckleberry

product_meta.title: National Wildlife Federation Field Guide to Wildflowers of North America
